Another great option could be "X-Men", a classic sci-fi film that explores the complex relationships between mutants fighting for survival against discrimination. Enjoy!

This film revolves around five medical students experimenting with death, offering a unique exploration of life and the unknown beyond. Starring Julia Roberts and Kiefer Sutherland, it's a thrilling sci-fi drama that might pique your interest.

Alternatively, if you fancy a suspenseful story set in our world, "Source Code" could be an enticing choice. Featuring Jake Gyllenhaal and Michelle Monaghan, this movie involves time travel and high-stakes action as a soldier finds himself reliving the same commuter train explosion over and over again.

I'd highly recommend "Divergent" for you. It's a captivating story set in a dystopian future where society is divided into factions based on human virtues. The protagonist, Tris, discovers she doesn't fit into any one group and must navigate through dangerous situations to protect herself and those around her.

If you're interested in something more experimental and thought-provoking, "Alex in Wonderland" might be up your alley. This film follows a film director as he navigates the complexities of art, commerce, and personal life while fantasizing about movie scenarios influenced by his idols.
